News.headline: Match Report: Braintree Town 3 - 2 Dagenham and Redbridge
News.page_title: Match Report: Braintree Town 3 - 2 Dagenham and Redbridge
News.URL_keywords: Match Report: Braintree Town 3 - 2 Dagenham and Redbridge
News.short_description: Dagenham & Redbridge suffered a 3-2 loss at Braintree Town in the first part of their National League double header.
News.description:
Daggers made one change for the trip to Cressing Road, with Sam Ling replacing Luke Guttridge, who missed out through injury.

Inside the first minute at Cressing Road, Corey Whitely saw a free-kick narrowly deflected over by the wall.

It took 27 minutes for the next decent chance to arrive, but Tyrique Hyde saw his effort blocked by Sean Clohessy after being played in by Oliver Hawkins.

Daggers took the lead five minutes later when Jordan Maguire-Drew found Oliver Hawkins with a cross into the box from the right.

The striker headed in his 14th goal of the season, but only after his effort had been pushed onto the post by Town keeper Sam Beasant on its way in.

Daggers were pegged back four minutes later when Michael Cheek lashed home after a spot of ping-pong in the box.

And Daggers went into the break a goal down when Sim Akinola scored a penalty in first half stoppage time after Josh Staunton fouled Reece Hall-Johnson in the box.

Less than 60 seconds into the second half, Daggers were awarded a penalty after Clohessy handled in the box.

Hawkins saw his initial spot kick saved, but Jordan Maguire-Drew slammed in after a melee in the box.

Daggers were reduced to 10 men in the 59th minute when Scott Doe was sent off for a second bookable offence.

And six minutes later, Akinola struck again to send the Iron back in front, though the hosts had Ebou Adams dismissed for a second yellow card with 17 minutes left.

Daggers, though, could not find an equaliser as the lost for the first time in four games on the road.
